column4: mdadm - raid-1, does the array (/dev/md0) have a diff UUID than that of it members /dev/sd* ?
Yes, very likely. Every partition should have a unique UUID, even if it is a virtual partition in raid.
ta that helps ... so uuidgen /dev/md0 , or vol_id /dev/md0 , or blkid ?

To be perfectly honest, I don't use the UUIDs much, as I'm comfortable updating paths when I swap drives & partitions around. /dev/md0 should behave as a normal live partition as far as the OS is concerned, its just more complicated booting to it.
